question: What is the correct Python expression for checking to see if a number stored in a variable x is between 0 and 5.

answers.feedback: Each comparison must be between exactly two values. In this case the right-hand expression < 5 lacks a value on its left.
The expression is equivalent to writing ``x > 0 and x < 5``, but this chained comparison is even more concise!
It will evaluate to true for all numbers that are either greater than 0 or less than 5. Because all numbers are either greater than 0 or less than 5, this expression will always be True!
Yes, with an ``and`` keyword both expressions must be true so the number must be greater than 0 an less than 5 for this expression to be true.
